banAuthor.description:
The banAuthor parameter lets you indicate that you want to automatically reject any additional comments written by the comment's author. Set the parameter value to true to ban the author.

Note: This parameter is only valid if the moderationStatus parameter is also set to rejected.
banAuthor.title: Ban Author

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.
fields.title: Fields

id.description: The id parameter specifies a comma-separated list of IDs that identify the comments for which you are updating the moderation status.
id.title: Id

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.
key.title: Key

moderationStatus.description: Identifies the new moderation status of the specified comments.
moderationStatus.title: Moderation Status

oauthToken.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.
oauthToken.title: Oauth Token

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.
prettyPrint.title: Pretty Print

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.
quotaUser.title: Quota User

userIp.description: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.
userIp.title: User Ip
